createColumnLayout(ArrayList<Point>, int, int, int, int, int, int) - Static method in class visualizer.display.Layouts

createFlexibleZLayout(ArrayList<Point>, int, int, int, int) - Static method in class visualizer.display.Layouts
Create a recursive Z-Curve that tries to create a square even on item sets of a size that differs from 4^n
createHilbertLayout(ArrayList, int, int, int, int) - Static method in class visualizer.display.Layouts
Create a recursive Hilbert Curve.
createJigsawLayout(ArrayList<VisualItem>, int, int, int, int, GlyphTable) - Static method in class visualizer.display.OptimizingLayouts
create an layout that puts all VisualItems on a grid; similar items are tried to be put close together;
createMDSLayout(ArrayList, int, int, int, int, GlyphTable) - Static method in class visualizer.display.OptimizingLayouts
create an layout that places all VisualItems on the screen, trying to keep similar items close together
createOrderedTableLayout(ArrayList<VisualItem>, int, int, int, int, GlyphTable) - Static method in class visualizer.display.OptimizingLayouts
create a table that puts items with high values to the top; if the data is 2D than a clustering is performed to arrange similar items together; this is not implemented for 3D data yet
createRowLayout(ArrayList<Point>, int, int, int, int, int, int) - Static method in class visualizer.display.Layouts
create a layout row by row
createTable2D(ArrayList<Point>, int, int, int, int, GlyphTable) - Static method in class visualizer.display.Layouts
create a table layout for 2D data; similar to row-by-row, but with descriptions each item
createZLayout(ArrayList<Point>, int, int, int, int) - Static method in class visualizer.display.Layouts
Create a recursive Morton Z-Curve; best results are achieved if the number of points in 4^n
